marklogic.body:
"Casablanca" is my favorite movie -- and, I think, the best film made to date -- not because of social expectations, but just because it's a wonderful film. And I'm a hopeless romantic.
"Citizen Kane" was a brilliant film, but I've only watched it a few times in my entire life. "Casablanca" I watch once a year or so. It's like sitting down to your favorite meal in a comfortable chair wearing your plushest robe, with a fire Burning in the fireplace.
And I still tear up every time at the scene at Rick's where the non-German ex-pats start singing "La Marseillaise". I'm old enough that my father fought in WWII (Pacific, not Europe, but still: Pearl Harbor, Guadalcanal, Guam), and I grew up with a keen sense of that conflict and how uncertain the outcome was to those who lived it. The film was made in 1941 -- before the US even got into the war -- and the lights were going out in Europe and along the Asian rim. I Always see the film in that light. ..bruce..
